news.title: JSW Cement garners ₹1,080 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
news.para: JSW Cement garnered Rs 1,080 crore from anchor investors, including Nomura and the Government of Singapore, prior to its IPO launch. The IPO, opening August 7-11, aims to raise Rs 3,600 crore through a fresh issue and offer for sale. Proceeds will fund a new cement unit and debt repayment, despite the company reporting a loss in FY25.

news.title: Land pooling policy put on hold till next hearing on Aug 7: Punjab AG submits in HC
news.para: The Punjab and Haryana High Court addressed a petition challenging Punjab's land pooling scheme. The state's advocate general announced a hold on the policy until the next hearing. The court questioned the policy's impact on landless laborers and the environment. It directed the state to provide information on rehabilitation provisions and impact assessments.

news.title: Prestige Hospitality Ventures get Sebi's nod for IPO
news.para: Prestige Hospitality Ventures, an arm of realty firm Prestige Estates Projects, is aiming to raise Rs 2,700 crore through its IPO, comprising a fresh issue of equity shares valued at Rs 1,700 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of equity shares worth Rs 1,000 crore, according to the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP).

news.title: Knowledge Realty Trust REIT IPO gets 3.4 times subscription on day 2 of offer
news.para: The NSDL IPO saw strong demand, being oversubscribed 3.42 times on its second day, driven by significant interest from corporates, individuals, and institutional investors. Knowledge Realty Trust's Rs 4,800-crore IPO, reduced from an initial Rs 6,200 crore, aims to monetise prime office assets and establish KRT as India's largest REIT.

news.title: Sri Lotus Developers and Realty stock rallies over 31% in debut trade
news.para: Sri Lotus Developers and Realty, backed by Ashish Kacholia, saw a strong market debut. The stock closed with over 31% premium on Wednesday. The IPO was subscribed nearly 70 times. The company raised funds from institutional investors. Sri Lotus focuses on luxury redevelopment projects in Mumbai. The market capitalization reached over Rs 9,620 crore.

news.title: IIT-Bombay’s report for PCMC recommends no housing project nearby Taloja MIDC
news.para: An IIT-Bombay report for Panvel Municipal Corporation highlights that Maharashtra Pollution Control Board does not monitor Taloja and Kasardi rivers. The report suggests no new housing near the dumping ground and Taloja MIDC. It urges waste-to-energy methods and better sewage disposal. The report also recommends regular water quality checks and strict rules against industrial waste discharge.

news.title: Property tax scam hits 1,000 residents in Ahmedabad
news.para: A property tax scam has surfaced in Ahmedabad, affecting over 1,000 property owners who had previously paid their dues. Touts allegedly manipulated the AMC system using employee login credentials to falsely clear outstanding amounts, pocketing the cash payments. The scam, dating back to 2017, has resulted in property owners receiving fresh bills, with the estimated value ranging from Rs 1.

news.title: Bhopal, Indore to become metro regions under 25-year plan
news.para: The Metro Area Bill has been passed in the House. It aims to declare Bhopal and Indore as metropolitan areas. The bill is a long-term strategy to address development challenges. Urban development minister Kailash Vijayvargiya spoke on the bill. Congress MLA Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat asked for the Master Plan for Bhopal and Indore.

news.title: Ranchi civic body orders fresh survey of its land to prevent encroachment
news.para: Ranchi Municipal Corporation has initiated a comprehensive survey of its land. The goal is to protect municipal properties from increasing encroachment. Drone surveillance revealed several instances of land grabbing. The survey will identify unused land for public amenities. RMC plans to install information boards on its plots. Vacant lands may be developed into community spaces.

news.title: Five IT firms get land in Visakhapatnam, pledge ₹19,000 crore investment
news.para: Visakhapatnam's tech scene is set for a major boost. The state government has allocated land to five IT companies. These include data center projects with a planned investment of Rs 19,000 crore. Sify, Phenom People, and others are among the beneficiaries. These projects promise thousands of new jobs. This development will significantly enhance the city's IT ecosystem.

news.title: Get two more years to regularise illegal structures in Goa
news.para: Goa's government has amended the Regularisation of Unauthorised Construction Act, 2016, offering a new two-year window for regularizing unauthorized constructions, even on comunidade or government land, provided the land tenure is already regularized. The amendment revises built-up area limits, allowing up to 500 sqm in panchayat areas and 600 sqm in municipal areas.

news.title: Pimpri Chinchwad: 50% tax waiver for properties in PCMC red zone from FY27
news.para: The PCMC has decided to grant a 50% tax discount to properties in the red zone starting April 2026, provided all pending dues are cleared. This decision, impacting over 43,000 properties near defense depots, aims to compensate residents for limited civic amenities. However, housing societies are protesting, deeming it unfair to regular taxpayers and potentially encouraging unauthorized construction.

news.title: Three new plants soon to tackle mounting construction waste in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram's Municipal Corporation (MCG) is planning to establish three C&D waste processing facilities across the city, including a large-scale plant near the Global City project. The initiative follows instructions from the Haryana urban local bodies department to develop a detailed C&D waste management strategy.

news.title: Karnataka government notifies revised setback rules for buildings in Bengaluru
news.para: Bengaluru has updated its building setback norms under the Revised Master Plan 2015, effective August 1st. The amendment clarifies open space requirements based on building height, especially for structures over 12 meters. It specifies setbacks for different plot sizes and building heights, including provisions for stilt parking.

news.title: Parliamentary panel pitches for ESG oversight body to combat greenwashing activities
news.para: A Parliamentary panel urges the corporate affairs ministry to establish an ESG oversight body to combat greenwashing and penalize fraudulent ESG claims. The panel recommends amending the Companies Act to integrate ESG objectives into directors' duties. Additionally, the ministry is asked to combat financial crimes and enhance the SFIO's effectiveness.

news.title: SC upholds SEIAA and SEAC's authority for project-level environmental clearances
news.para: The Supreme Court has settled the issue of who grants environmental clearances. State authorities will continue to handle project-level approvals. This decision resolves a deadlock affecting numerous housing projects in Mumbai and Pune. The court upheld most of a 2025 notification but removed some exemptions. This ruling brings clarity to environmental regulations for real estate.

news.title: Lucknow development body eases norms for housing maps, gives nod to new building bylaws
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority approved several key urban development proposals, including allowing residential building maps on narrower government roads under certain conditions. High-tech housing projects, a modern bus terminal, and e-vehicle infrastructure were also approved. Furthermore, the LDA will sell commercial properties on a first-come, first-served basis and is advancing affordable housing initiatives.

news.title: Haryana RERA serves notice to Ramprastha Promoters & Developers
news.para: Real Estate Regulatory Authority has warned Ramprastha Promoters about civil imprisonment. This is due to non-compliance with pending orders. The warning follows the arrest of directors Arvind Walia and Sandeep Yadav. They are involved in a money laundering case of Rs 1,100 crore. The case involves over 2,000 duped homebuyers.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh CM inaugurates Atal Puram Township project in Agra
news.para: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath launched the Atal Puram Township project in Agra. Officials say it is the Agra Development Authority's largest housing project in 36 years. The project spans 340 acres and will house nearly 10,000 families. It includes residential, group housing, and commercial plots. The township will feature modern infrastructure and public facilities.

news.title: Singapore's CapitaLand Integrated to acquire remaining stake in CapitaSpring
news.para: CapitaLand Integrated Commercial Trust will acquire the remaining stake in CapitaSpring. The deal is valued at S$1.05 billion. CapitaLand Development and Mitsubishi Estate are the sellers. The acquisition will increase CapitaLand Integrated's Singapore exposure. It will be funded through a private placement. The company expects a distribution per unit accretion of 1.1%.
